IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: This is the planned power cut that was previously scheduled for last year but was cancelled on the day due to access issues. To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. We will remove the existing transformer and install a new one on the same day. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out this essential. To connect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work is taking place near Rabans Lane.

This work is taking place on Whitworth
Road. We are connecting a new property to the underground electricity network, following a request from
a customer. Due to how the electricity network is configured and the type of cable our engineers
are needing to work on we will need to temporarily switch off your power to safely carry out this
work.

connected to the network. We appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned
power cuts in the last 6 months.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. We need to replace and upgrade a piece of equipment called switchgear within one of our substations, which controls and protects the electricity network. Once complete this will allow remote switching so that we can get your power back on faster in the event of an unplanned power cut. During this time our engineers will need to temporarily switch off your power for a short duration to reroute your electricity supply, to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out the works. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Pound Lane.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 00:24 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Belmont Street area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have now repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 23:03 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 18:37 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 399 customers in the Lewes BN7 2 area to safely repair a fault on our overhead network.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

If your power is off, you can get live updates here: http://www.ukpowernetworks.co.uk/power-cut

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 19:44 - We can now confirm that all power in the London Road SS17 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 19:24 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 18:54 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the London Road SS17 area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 22:30 and 23:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Sent by Bev at 05:16 - Thanks for your patience today, we're happy to say our staff have now restored power to all but one property in the Royal Oak Drive area. I'm sorry for any disruption we caused by having to turn off your power to repair an unexpected underground cable fault.

We'd still like to keep you informed if your electricity hasn't been restored. Please call us free any time on 08003163105 if we haven't already reached out to you by phone or in person at your property.

We apologise for the outage and understand that being without power can be challenging. Rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep your lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 04:23 - Thanks for your patience over tonight.

Our engineers have let us know that the repairs to the underground cable fault are more complex than previously anticipated. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 04:30 and 05:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Bev at 02:06

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 03:36 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers on site are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 05:48 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power on the underground network in the Ashford TN24 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Ashford TN24 area to investigate the power cut currently affecting 221 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Bev at 05:12.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  Our engineers have attended the fault, and have made an emergency repair to restore power to as many premises as possible.  It is our intention to return to make a permanent repair as soon as we can.  I'm sorry, but we can't give you a time for this at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 07:57 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead cabling fault that initially interrupted power to 594 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 138 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 09:30-10:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way
